meanings.definition: A day of religious observance and abstinence from work, kept by Jews from Friday evening to Saturday evening, and by most Christians on Sunday.
meanings.sent1: On the sabbath, we attend church and refrain from working.
meanings.sent2: Many families gather for a meal after church on the sabbath.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to understand the concept of the sabbath and lazily lounged around all day.
meanings.sent4: The sabbath is like a peaceful island in the midst of a busy week.
meanings.sent5: The sabbath brings a sense of calm and spiritual rejuvenation to our lives.

meanings.definition: A time of rest or reflection.
meanings.sent1: After a long week, I look forward to the sabbath to relax and recharge.
meanings.sent2: The sabbath allows us to pause and appreciate the beauty of life.
meanings.sent3: The sabbath is like a cozy blanket wrapping us in tranquility.
meanings.sent4: In the quiet of the sabbath, I find clarity and peace of mind.
meanings.sent5: The sabbath is a precious gift of stillness in our fast-paced world.
